akn:section.akn:heading: Expenditures and audit of Trust Fund

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 2010. Expenditures and audit of Trust Fund(a) Authorization of fundingThe Secretary is authorized to pay to the Foundation from the interest and earnings of the fund such sums as the Board determines are necessary and appropriate to enable the Foundation to carry out the purposes of this chapter.
(b) Access to books, records, etc., by Government Accountability OfficeThe activities of the Foundation under this chapter may be audited by the Government Accountability Office under such rules and regulations as may be prescribed by the Comptroller General of the United States. The representatives of the Government Accountability Office shall have access to all books, accounts, records, reports, and files and all other papers, things, or property belonging to or in use by the Foundation, pertaining to such activities and necessary to facilitate the audit.
(Pub. L. 93–642, § 11, Jan. 4, 1975, 88 Stat. 2279; Pub. L. 108–271, § 8(b), July 7, 2004, 118 Stat. 814.)
